title: Ronnie Wood, 72, and wife Sally Humphreys, 41, attend premiere for Somebody Up There Likes Me
text:
He is one of the most iconic rockers in the world.

And Ronnie Wood, 72, looked in high spirits as he was joined by his wife Sally Humphreys, 41, at the world premiere for his documentary Somebody Up There Likes Me on Saturday night.

Arriving in style to the event during the 63rd BFI London Film Festival at the BFI Southbank, the star put on a dapper display as he cosied up to his stylish other half.

Loved-up: Ronnie Wood, 72, was joined by his wife Sally Humphreys, 41, at the world premiere for his documentary Somebody Up There Likes Me on Saturday night

Sally looked sensational in her floral midi-dress which boasted a ruffled tiered hem and showed off her sensational legs.

The beauty, who is owner of a theatre production company, boosted her height in a pair of open-toe towering gold heels.

Sally added to her look with a glamorous slick of red lipstick, which complemented her glossy brunette locks, and she accessorised with a statement necklace.

Arriving in style to the event during the 63rd BFI London Film Festival at the BFI Southbank, the star put on a dapper display as he cosied up to his stylish other half

Sally looked sensational in her floral midi-dress which boasted a ruffled tiered hem and showed off her sensational legs

Looking good: Sally added to her look with a glamorous slick of red lipstick, which complemented her glossy brunette locks, and she accessorised with a statement necklace

Handsome: Ronnie looked super suave in a slick black a-line suit which he teamed with a simple white top

Meanwhile, Ronnie looked super suave in a slick black a-line suit which he teamed with a simple white top.

The pair, who are doting parents to twin daughters, Alice and Gracie, three, looked happy and relaxed as they posed away.

The couple tied the knot in December 2012 and welcomed little Gracie and Alice into the world in May 2016, two days before Ronnie's 69th birthday.

Ronnie is also father to Jesse, 40, whom he shares with his late first wife Krissy. The former flames were married from 1971 to 1978.

Why hello: Ronnie put on an animated display as he posed away at the premiere

Happy: The pair, who are doting parents to twin daughters, Alice and Gracie, three, looked happy and relaxed as they posed away

Pals: Meanwhile, Ronnie's The Rolling Stones bandmate Mick Jagger, 76, also turned up to the event to show his support

Documentary; Somebody Up There Likes Me follows the life story of Ronnie's rise to the top

Plot: An array of archive footage and candid interviews takes viewers on his biographical journey from his childhood to his international success with The Rolling Stones

The music legend shares daughter Leah, 39, as well as sons Tyrone, 34, and Jamie, 43, with his second wife Jo Wood, whom he was married to from 1985 to 2008.

Meanwhile, Ronnie's The Rolling Stones bandmate Mick Jagger, 76, also turned up to the event to show his support.

Somebody Up There Likes Me follows the life story of Ronnie's rise to the top.

An array of archive footage and candid interviews takes viewers on his biographical journey from his childhood to his international success with The Rolling Stones.

Looking good: Mick was certainly stylish in a pinstripe shirt and blazer, complete with a bright green belt

Squad: The pals were joined by singer Imelda May, 45, who looked super cool in a black LBD with exposed zipper detailing
description: Ronnie Wood, 72, looked in high spirits as he was joined by his wife Sally Humphreys, 41, at the world premiere for his documentary Somebody Up There Likes Me on Saturday night.
